As an operator I need insights (metrics) and notifications for all kyma components and the kubernetes cluster itself to ensure a stable environment and investigate critical situations.

- have alerts for basic system metrics
- assure usability of reports

API Gateway.title: Authorization server in Kyma
API Gateway.body:
**Description**

Currently, Kyma supports only API authentication and does not offer authorization. Authentication is covered by istio policy which relies on id tokens validation. API Gateway lacks the feature of applying authorization to an exposed API. Internal communication can be covered with istio RBAC rules but it cannot be applied for incoming requests from external services/applications. For developers creating for example lambdas and exposing them to the public internet, it is beneficial to allow service to service communication with autn and authz in place. Moreover, it's not possible to fetch token in service to service without the context of the user.

Solutions to investigate :
- OAuth2 server (https://github.com/ory/hydra)
- OPA (https://www.openpolicyagent.org/)
- Integration with istio one of the solutions
- ...



**Reasons**

Enrich API gateway functionality with authZ capabilities. Allow fetching tokens without the context of the user.

**Attachments**

Eventing.title: Provide support for data events in Kyma eventing
Eventing.body:
**Description**
The current Kyma eventing model semantics fits better for business events which contain minimalistic data such as object-ids and then the serverless pulls the data from the application.

There could be other scenarios where the application would like to send data events that contain the full object e.g. a `purchase order`. Such events can be used to synchronize among various applications connected via Kyma. In such scenarios, we will need additional semantics that fits with data events such as `correlation-ids` and other business metadata (possibly as headers) that might be required by the receiver to identify the source and other domain information.

Eventing.title: Provide support for in-cluster events
Eventing.body:
**Description**
As a developer, I should be able to define and generate internal events to trigger asynchronous business workflows.

At present, the eventing in Kyma is tightly coupled with the aspect of events being sent by an external solution. e.g. `source-id` which identifies the external solution is used as a part of publishing an event in Kyma.

For events generated inside Kyma, the following open questions or design details needs to be answered:

* How the origin of the internal event is identified? (events originated from the Kyma environments???)
* How the event schema will be published?
* How the event schema will be made available to the developers?
* Do we need concepts such as event activation for internal events?

Service Management.title: Helm Broker creates Service Class documentation from add-ons
Service Management.body:
**Description**

Store bundle's documentation in bundle itself via the Headless CMS functionality.

**Reasons**

We don't want to store bundle documentation in kyma itself, as it is right now.

**AC**
- Not estimated in that story (all bundles docs moved to respective bundles (https://github.com/kyma-project/kyma/issues/3577))
- helm-broker uploads bundle documentation as ClusterDocsTopic during repository registration
- that solution must support documentation registration from bundle but with external resources (md, swagger, asyncAPI specs), see details in the `technical details section`
- HB removes given ClusterDocsTopic when repository URL is deregistered
- helm-broker pass repository URL parameter to given bundle (Could be used in helm-chart of the given bundle to upload documentation for given namespace by DocsTopic for example Azure Service Classess documentation)
- ~using ClusterDocsTopic and DocsTopis only if those CRDs exists~
- show refactoring on our Redis bundle

**Technical Details**
- about AC: `documentation registration from bundle but with external resources`, see how it can be realized: https://github.com/PK85/add-ons/blob/master/addons/slack-connector-0.1.0/docs/cluster-docs-topic.yaml . And HB will take that CR and install, of course in case documentation is provided in a bundle itself, HB need to adjust URLs to bundleRespository what was registered to HB with given bundle.

See, dependency:
- https://github.com/kyma-project/console/issues/666
- https://github.com/kyma-project/kyma/pull/3292/files
